meanings.sent1: I spent the afternoon totaling my expenses for the month.
meanings.sent2: She is totaling the scores for the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried totaling the number of treats in the jar.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was totaling the number of days until his birthday.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made totaling the numbers in the math problem a fun challenge.

meanings.definition: The act of adding up or summing
meanings.sent1: Totaling can be a tedious task, but it is necessary for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The totaling of the grocery bill was quick and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The robot's job was to do the totaling of the inventory.
meanings.sent4: The totaling of the votes determined the winner of the election.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite part of the job was the totaling of the sales at the end of the day.

meanings.sent1: The totaling of all the donations reached an impressive number.
meanings.sent2: The totaling of the expenses showed they were under budget.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making the totaling of the cards disappear.
meanings.sent4: The totaling of the ingredients created a delicious recipe.
meanings.sent5: The totaling of the points determined the winning team.
